NRCC bails on Coffman, targets Shalala
paragraph:
GOP Colorado Rep. Mike Coffman lagged his opponent in public and private polling and is now being cut loose by the National Republican Congressional Committee. | Larry French/Getty Images for SiriusXM
Elections
                    By ELENA SCHNEIDER10/19/2018 05:12 PM EDTThe National Republican Campaign Committee’s independent expenditure unit is pulling out of Colorado Rep. Mike Coffman’s district in the Denver suburbs, while jumping into the open race in Florida’s 27th Congressional District, according to a source familiar with the decision.The committee is pulling about $1 million from Coffman’s district, as the Republican congressman has lagged behind Democrat Jason Crow in private and public polling.Story Continued BelowThe NRCC, meanwhile, is adding about $1.5 million in broadcast and cable TV ads in Miami to boost Republican Maria Elvira Salazar, who’s running to replace GOP Rep. Ileana Ros-Lehtinen in a district that backed Hillary Clinton by 19 points. Salazar is running against Democrat Donna Shalala, the former University of Miami president who’s struggled to put away this Democratic-leaning district in South Florida.Missing out on the latest scoops?
